name: The forest for the trees
description: Marshmallow Laser Feast's Sanctuary of the Unseen Forest celebrates the majestic Colombian kapok tree. Let's look back at some of screen culture's other mighty trees and forests.

key_work.title: Sanctuary of the Unseen Forest
key_work.credit_line: Marshmallow Laser Feast in collaboration with Andres Roberts and James Bulley
key_work.brief_description: Sanctuary of the Unseen Forest is a large-scale video installation that creates a moment of awe, felt when we embrace the presence of a majestic being, a giant Ceiba Pentandra from the Colombian Amazon.

constellations_primary.name: The forest for the trees
constellations_primary.description: Marshmallow Laser Feast's Sanctuary of the Unseen Forest celebrates the majestic Colombian kapok tree. Let's look back at some of screen culture's other mighty trees and forests.

constellations_other.name: Scene-stealing giants
constellations_other.description: We Live in an Ocean of Air takes viewers inside the cycle of life through a giant sequoia (commonly known as a giant redwood). Find out how their ancient awesomeness has seen them loom over screen culture.

start.title: The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers
start.creator_credit: Barrie M. Osborne, Fran Walsh and Peter Jackson
start.headline_credit: New Zealand and United States of America, 2002

video_links.name: The Two Towers | The Lord of the Rings 4K Ultra HD | Warner Bros. Entertainment

start.brief_description: Frodo and Sam trek to Mordor to destroy the One Ring of Power while Gimli, Legolas and Aragorn search for the orc-captured Merry and Pippin. All along, nefarious wizard Saruman awaits the Fellowship members at the Orthanc Tower in Isengard.

constellations_other.name: Infinity and beyond
constellations_other.description: The constantly evolving characters in Infinity are created through procedural generation, a technique that creates special effects, characters, videogame levels and sound via a set of algorithms, predefined rules or data inputs.

constellations_other.name: The forest for the trees
constellations_other.description: Marshmallow Laser Feast's Sanctuary of the Unseen Forest celebrates the majestic Colombian kapok tree. Let's look back at some of screen culture's other mighty trees and forests.

constellations_other.name: Sci-fi miniatures
constellations_other.description: As filmmaking technologies have changed and evolved over the decades, much like audiences, miniatures have endured as one of the most effective film special effects.

end.title: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
end.headline_credit: Germany, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2002
end.brief_description: Cars fly, trees fight back, and a mysterious house-elf comes to warn Harry Potter at the start of his second year at Hogwarts. Adventure and danger await when bloody writing on a wall announces: The Chamber Of Secrets Has Been Opened. To save Hogwarts will require all of Harry, Ron and Hermione’s magical abilities and courage.

constellations_other.name: Drawing on influences
constellations_other.description: Waves of animators have been inspired by the style of previous animators to help tell their own stories.

constellations_other.name: The forest for the trees
constellations_other.description: Marshmallow Laser Feast's Sanctuary of the Unseen Forest celebrates the majestic Colombian kapok tree. Let's look back at some of screen culture's other mighty trees and forests.

links.description: With similarly branch-like arms, the magical Whomping Willow will attack anything within its reach. The tree has taken some damage itself with Harry and Ron crashing a flying Ford Anglia at the start of their second year at Hogwarts.

start.title: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
start.headline_credit: Germany, United Kingdom and United States of America, 2002
start.brief_description: Cars fly, trees fight back, and a mysterious house-elf comes to warn Harry Potter at the start of his second year at Hogwarts. Adventure and danger await when bloody writing on a wall announces: The Chamber Of Secrets Has Been Opened. To save Hogwarts will require all of Harry, Ron and Hermione’s magical abilities and courage.

end.title: FernGully: The Last Rainforest
end.creator_credit: Bill Kroyer, Diana Young, Peter Faiman, Wayne Young, 20th Century Fox, FAI Films, Kroyer Films, Youngheart Productions and Jim Cox
end.headline_credit: Australia and United States of America, 1992
end.brief_description: When a sprite named Crysta shrinks a human boy, Zak, down to her size, he vows to help the magical fairy folk stop a greedy logging company from destroying their home: the pristine rainforest known as FernGully. Zak and his new friends fight to defend FernGully from lumberjacks — and the vengeful spirit they accidentally unleash after chopping down a magic tree.

constellations_other.name: There is no Planet B
constellations_other.description: While the climate emergency is very real, inspiring thousands and thousands of students to strike, documentaries, animated movies and dystopian genre films have warned about a world ravaged by global warming.

constellations_other.name: The forest for the trees
constellations_other.description: Marshmallow Laser Feast's Sanctuary of the Unseen Forest celebrates the majestic Colombian kapok tree. Let's look back at some of screen culture's other mighty trees and forests.

links.description: While some trees can protect themselves, others rely on help. Fern Gully is home to animals and fairies who fight to save their rainforest from loggers and polluters. An animated classic, Fern Gully is a call to action for kids and adults alike.

links.description: The Lord of the Rings film series features Treebeard, a shepherd of trees created to protect forests from the destruction of the Elves. Treebeard is one of the oldest living things in Middle-earth – like the kopak on our Earth.

start.title: FernGully: The Last Rainforest
start.creator_credit: Bill Kroyer, Diana Young, Peter Faiman, Wayne Young, 20th Century Fox, FAI Films, Kroyer Films, Youngheart Productions and Jim Cox
start.headline_credit: Australia and United States of America, 1992
start.brief_description: When a sprite named Crysta shrinks a human boy, Zak, down to her size, he vows to help the magical fairy folk stop a greedy logging company from destroying their home: the pristine rainforest known as FernGully. Zak and his new friends fight to defend FernGully from lumberjacks — and the vengeful spirit they accidentally unleash after chopping down a magic tree.

constellations_other.name: There is no Planet B
constellations_other.description: While the climate emergency is very real, inspiring thousands and thousands of students to strike, documentaries, animated movies and dystopian genre films have warned about a world ravaged by global warming.

end.title: Ori and the Blind Forest
end.brief_description: The forest of Nibel is dying. After a powerful storm sets a series of devastating events in motion, an unlikely hero must journey to find his courage and confront a dark nemesis to save his home. Ori and the Blind Forest tells the tale of a young orphan destined for heroics, through a visually stunning action-platformer crafted by Moon Studios for Xbox One and PC. Featuring hand-painted artwork, meticulously animated character performance, and a fully orchestrated score, Ori and the Blind Forest explores a deeply emotional story about love and sacrifice, and the hope that exists in us all.

constellations_other.name: The forest for the trees
constellations_other.description: Marshmallow Laser Feast's Sanctuary of the Unseen Forest celebrates the majestic Colombian kapok tree. Let's look back at some of screen culture's other mighty trees and forests.

links.description: In the videogame Ori and the Blind Forest, Ori has to battle a dark nemesis to save the dying forest. Along the way, Ori works with the light and eyes of the forest’s Spirit Tree, which is similar to the fairies in Fern Gully.

start.title: Ori and the Blind Forest
start.brief_description: The forest of Nibel is dying. After a powerful storm sets a series of devastating events in motion, an unlikely hero must journey to find his courage and confront a dark nemesis to save his home. Ori and the Blind Forest tells the tale of a young orphan destined for heroics, through a visually stunning action-platformer crafted by Moon Studios for Xbox One and PC. end.title: Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind
end.creator_credit: Hayao Miyazaki, Naoki Kaneko, Shouji Sakai, Tomoko Kida, Isao Takahata, Toshio Suzuki and Topcraft

video_links.name: Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind - Official Trailer

end.brief_description: After a global war, the seaside kingdom known as the Valley of the Wind remains one of the last strongholds on Earth untouched by a poisonous jungle and the powerful insects that guard it. Led by the courageous Princess Nausicaä, the people of the Valley engage in an epic struggle to restore the bond between humanity and Earth.

constellations_other.name: The forest for the trees
constellations_other.description: Marshmallow Laser Feast's Sanctuary of the Unseen Forest celebrates the majestic Colombian kapok tree. Let's look back at some of screen culture's other mighty trees and forests.

constellations_other.name: Change Through Actions
constellations_other.description: Young people are increasingly being seen on screen as the faces of environmental advocacy and care. Explore how these films, TV series, and videogames explore environmental issues and solutions from the perspectives of young people.

links.description: The makers of Ori and the Blind Forest were influenced by Hayao Miyazaki. The level “Valley of the Wind” pays homage to Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind. Like Ori, Nausicaä works with the forest and its creatures to save her world.

start.title: Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind
start.creator_credit: Hayao Miyazaki, Naoki Kaneko, Shouji Sakai, Tomoko Kida, Isao Takahata, Toshio Suzuki and Topcraft

video_links.name: Nausicaä of the Valley of the Wind - Official Trailer

start.brief_description: After a global war, the seaside kingdom known as the Valley of the Wind remains one of the last strongholds on Earth untouched by a poisonous jungle and the powerful insects that guard it. Led by the courageous Princess Nausicaä, the people of the Valley engage in an epic struggle to restore the bond between humanity and Earth.

end.title: Succession
end.creator_credit: Gary Sanchez Productions and Hyperobject Industries
end.brief_description: The lives of the Roy family as they contemplate their future once their aging father begins to step back from the media and entertainment conglomerate they control.

constellations_other.name: Quiet luxury, loud transformations
constellations_other.description: In The Dressmaker, Gertrude (Sarah Snook) transforms from 'dowdy' to elegant when she attends a dance in this dress. It's a popular cinema trope that shows how characters develop, but the 'makeover' trope isn't always a positive.

constellations_other.name: The forest for the trees
constellations_other.description: Marshmallow Laser Feast's Sanctuary of the Unseen Forest celebrates the majestic Colombian kapok tree. Let's look back at some of screen culture's other mighty trees and forests.

constellations_other.name: The spectre of the Romanovs
constellations_other.description: The Romanov dynasty has become a symbol of opulence throughout popular culture. Their final costume ball is even referenced in the coronation mood boards for Tony McNamara's The Great. Let's look at their history on-screen.

links.description: Like Nausicaä, Succession’s “oldest boy” Kendall Roy also takes comfort in nature. So much so, that he builds a giant replica of his childhood treehouse as the VIP area for his 40th birthday.
